intro: Knautia × posoniensis, commonly known as the hybrid knautia, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the family Caprifoliaceae and is characterized by its showy, clustered inflorescences of pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features soft, hairy stems and lobed, heart-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Due to its ornamental value and ease of cultivation, it is widely appreciated by gardeners and botanists alike.
